articles.title: Leaflets praising Kim Il Sung appear in S. Korea
articles.content:
Leaflets praising Kim Il Sung appear in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- Scores of leaflets praising President Kim Il Sung were found in the compound of the building of the "National Assembly" in Youido, Seoul, on Tuesday afternoon, according to CBS of South Korea.
 A picture of the president and letters praising him were seen on the front of the leaflets in the name of the Paektusan society.    
 Printed on their back were Kim Jong Il's propositions about the greatness of the president.

Special congress of international martial art games committee held
articles.content:
Special congress of international martial art games committee held 
    Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- A special congress of the international martial art games committee was held in Pyongyang.
 Present at the congress were chairman Mac Harb, the vice-president, the secretary general and members of the international martial art games committee.    
 Jang Ung, president of the international Taekwon-do federation, was elected president of the international martial art games committee.

Kim Yong Nam receives credentials from New Zealand Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam receives credentials from New Zealand Ambassador
    Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from David Leslie Taylor, newly-appointed New Zealand Ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 The president conversed with the ambassador after receiving credentials.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop meets Thai women's delegation
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop meets Thai women's delegation
    Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a conversation with the delegation of the national council of women of Thailand led by its president Yuwadee Nimsomboon at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 The head of the delegation said that the members of the delegation came to clearly know about the warm love shown by Kim Jong Il for the Korean women and children during its stay in the DPRK.    
 She said she would contribute to further developing the friendly relations between the two countries by consolidating the ties between their women's organizations.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the National Council of Women of Thailand.
 It was handed to Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, today by Yuwadee Nimsomboon, president of the council, on a visit to the DPRK.
